poem:
**Stirring Black Coffee**

This morning I woke  
to the scent of expectation  
filling the kitchen,  
a jolt of caffeine dream,  
while outside,  
sparrows cast shadows  
like swift whispers  
across the lawn.  
The paper tells stories  
but here, in this  
simple solace,  
I find the real poetry  
in the steam  
and quiet breath  
of dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Poem of the week: When you Wake you’ll Believe you are a Theatre Critic by Aaron Kent When you Wake you’ll Believe you are a Theatre Critic (Kent, The One and Only Tony Lonely, 2017) (I) Concentricity is measured in vaudevilleperformers weighing down on an imitationof intimacy. It isn’t, but stick a linelike that in a poem and you’ve subvertedany expectation the reader had. (II) A transmission is what happenswhen status is blind tosomebody else’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Poem of the week: When you Wake you’ll Believe you are a Theatre Critic by Aaron Kent When you Wake you’ll Believe you are a Theatre Critic (Kent, The One and Only Tony Lonely, 2017) (I) Concentricity is measured in vaudevilleperformers weighing down on an imitationof intimacy. It isn’t, but stick a linelike that in a poem and you’ve subvertedany expectation the reader had. (II) A transmission is what happenswhen status is blind tosomebody else’s
